department.dept_long_name: Department of the History of Art and Architecture

course.title: Architecture of Empire: The Ottomans, Safavids and Mughals in a Comparative Perspective
course.description: Between the 16th and 18th centuries, three empires - the Mediterranean-based Ottomans, Safavids in Iran, and Mughals in India - developed interconnected yet distinctive architectural cultures with individualized ornamental idioms by fusing their common Timurid heritage with cosmopolitan regional traditions. Explores connections between empire building and architecture, with respect to aesthetics, religion, imperial ideology, and theories of dynastic legitimacy.
